rationale: The product meets 3 out of 4 launch criteria. User satisfaction (0.72) exceeds minimum threshold (0.70). Churn risk (0.18) is below maximum acceptable (0.20). Day 7 retention (0.85) exceeds target (0.80). However, viral coefficient (0.9) falls short of target (1.0), indicating the product won't achieve viral growth without additional referral mechanics. Despite missing viral target, the product shows strong core metrics and can launch successfully with post-launch focus on improving referral features.

risks.description: Viral coefficient below 1.0 means organic growth will be slow
risks.mitigation: Implement referral incentives and sharing features post-launch

risks.description: Expert users show lower satisfaction (0.68) than novices (0.75)
risks.mitigation: Add keyboard shortcuts and power user features in next release

risks.description: Mobile app friction affects 70% of users
risks.mitigation: Prioritize mobile feature parity in first update

opportunities.description: Natural language task creation is a major differentiator
opportunities.action: Highlight this feature in marketing and onboarding

opportunities.description: Clean interface resonates strongly with users
opportunities.action: Emphasize simplicity in positioning and branding

opportunities.description: Collaboration features have low adoption but high satisfaction when used
opportunities.action: Improve discoverability and onboarding for team features

recommendations: Proceed with launch - core product metrics are strong
Skip tutorial for experienced users in launch version
Add referral program within 30 days post-launch
Mobile app feature parity in first major update (60 days)
Monitor expert user satisfaction closely post-launch
